intro: Cadaba juncea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water. It is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. Cadaba juncea is often used in traditional medicine and landscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
